intro: Trichotosia biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered trichotosia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in dry, open habitats and is known for its ecological importance to local pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
